text.content:
Age: 56  GENDER: FEMALE   RACE: RACE UNKNOWN 
MARITAL STATUS:  Married.

 

                           CLINICAL HISTORY

PRESENTING CHIEF COMPLAINT: 
Suicidal Ideation


HISTORY OF CURRENT ILLNESS:
The patient indicates over the past week she has been having increasingly more 
intrusive thoughts that she would be better off dead.  She says at first she was 
able to talk herself out of this by focusing on her family and how sad it would 
make 
them if she were to commit suicide.  However, most recently she has not been 
able to 
avoid these thoughts and has recently been arranging a plan to take all of her 
medications with the intent of killing herself.  She was concerned for her 
safety so 
she came to the VA ER to be evaluated.  She continues to feel suicidal at this 
time. 
She is agreeable to being admitted to psychiatric unit for an inpatient stay.


PAST PSYCHIATRIC HISTORY: 
The patient has history of depression.  She has never been admitted for psych 
reasons previously.  She does see MH regularly, about every 3-6 months.  She had 
been adequately controlled for a number of years prior to the current episode.


HISTORY OF SUICIDAL ACTS AND SELF-HARM: 
None

HISTORY OF VIOLENCE/ASSAULTING OTHERS/LEGAL PROBLEMS:
None

SUBSTANCE USE HISTORY: 
None

MENTAL ILLNESS AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE IN FAMILY MEMBERS: 
None

PSYCHOSOCIAL HISTORY: 
 a) Childhood/Developmental History: She had a good childhood and denies h/o 
abuse.


 b) Adult Relationship History: Denies abuse.


 c) Current significant family and/or peer group relationships: 
She has not been getting along well with her husband over the last month, but 
otherwise they have had a happy marriage and she indicates her husband is 
generally very supportive.


 d) Financial Status, Housing, Employment, Leisure Time Issues: Stable finances 
and housing.  She does not work, but her husband does.


 e) Religious/Spiritual or Cultural Issues that might influence treatment: 
None

 f) Relevant community resources accessed by patient:
None 

MILITARY HISTORY:
Branch:
Navy in the 1980's.


                          MEDICAL INFORMATION

(include response to medications, any medication side effects)
 a) CURRENT MEDICAL PROBLEMS: Cholesterol Elevation, Diabetes, Hypertension, 
Other (specify)
    Hypothyroidism

 b) CURRENT SIGNIFICANT PAIN PROBLEMS: 
 
 c) NUTRITION ASSESSMENT: 
 d) CURRENT VA-PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS: 
Active Inpatient Medications (excluding Supplies):
 
     Active Inpatient Medications                           Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
5)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
7)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
9)   VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE
 
 e) CURRENT NON-VA MEDICATIONS: 
    None 
 f) CURRENT NICOTINE AND CAFFEINE USE: 
    none

ALLERGIES AND ADVERSE DRUG REACTIONS: 
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE

 
MENTAL STATUS EXAM:
-------------------
ORIENTATION AND CONSCIOUSNESS:
  alert and attentive
  oriented x3
APPEARANCE AND BEHAVIOR:
  grooming appropriate
  psychomotor retardation
  details: 
    sad, suicidal
SPEECH:
  increased latency of response
  poverty of speech
  slow
LANGUAGE:
  intact
MOOD AND AFFECT:
  affect is congruent with mood
  mood depressed
PERCEPTUAL DISTURBANCE (hallucinations, illusions):
  none
THOUGHT PROCESS AND ASSOCIATION:
  normal, coherent
THOUGHT CONTENT (delusions, obsessions etc.):
  obsessions
  details:  suicidal thoughts
SUICIDAL OR VIOLENT IDEATION:
  suicidal ideation active with plan, will not contract for safety
  Other:  no homicidal ideation
INSIGHT:
  limited
JUDGMENT: 
  impaired
MEMORY: 
  intact
FUND OF KNOWLEDGE
    Average
ASSESSMENT OF DANGER TO SELF:
--------------------------------------
SUICIDE RISK CHECKLIST:
  Suicide ideation, Suicide plan, Access to means to implement a plan, Sense of 
hopelessness, History of substance abuse
PROTECTIVE FACTORS:
  Evidence of accessible and positively motivated social supports, Therapeutic 
alliance with a mental health professional
ASSESSMENT OF SUICIDE RISK:
The patient is an imminent threat to herself.

ASSESSMENT OF DANGER TO OTHERS:
-------------------------------------
No significant risk.
SUMMARY AND FORMULATION:
------------------------
Decompensated depression with active suicidal ideation with plan.
                      INITIAL DSM-IV DIAGNOSIS:
Axis I Clinical Disorder:
  Depressive Disorder:  Major Depression
  Marital Problems
Axis II Personality Disorders/Traits:
  None
Axis III Current Medical Conditions:  See Medical History above
Axis IV Current Psychosocial Stressors:
 social environment
 
Axis V GAF Score (current level of functioning): 20
Initial Treatment Plan:
The patient will be admitted to psychiatry for further 
evaluation/monitoring/treatment.
Long Term goals Reduce thoughts of suicide and contract for safety prior to 
discharge.

Anticipated discharge date: 7-10 days.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN
